text:
Riverside Drive, east side, at 116th Street, during the Memorial Day Celebration.
1891. - May 31
Ewing Gallaway.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Memorial Day.
The Colosseum. Riverside Drive, South Corner of One Hundred and Sixteenth Street.
The Paterno. Riverside Drive, West One Hundred and Sixteenth Street and Claremont Avenue (Block Front).
The Brookfield. Riverside Drive near One Hundred and Sixteenth Street.

text:
Riverside Drive, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of 116th Street.
About 1923.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

(1)
North (Hudson) River, skyline, north from West 116th (right) to West 130th Streets, showing (right center) the Tomb of General U.S. Grant, and to its left, International House. Also shown (left) is the landing of the Fort Lee (N.J.) Ferry and the excursion boat "Trojan".
1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, showing in addition Riverside Church and to its right; towers of Union Theological Seminary.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, as view No. 2.

P. L. Sperr.
June 8, 1934.
title: North (Hudson) River - Shore and skyline - Manhattan - 59th Street - George Washington Bridge - [Riverside Baptist Church - International House of Columbia University.]

text:
Harlem River, Manhattan: A northwestward view of the Manhattan shoreline showing buildings at the foot of East 116th Street. The new East River Drive, skirting the waters edge has caused major changes in this locality, prominent of which is the disappearance of the ferry slips at the foot of the aforementioned point.

July 19, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Harlem River - Manhattan - East 116th Street.
